body_html:
I have exactly the same issue with mac os 10.13.1 and python 3.6 via anaconda, when pytorch is installed from the source, both in 0.2.0 and 0.3.0.

In [1]: import torch

In [2]: import numpy as np

In [3]: x = torch.randn(100).type(torch.FloatTensor)

In [4]: torch.dot(x,x)
Out[4]: -3.6893488147419103e+19

In [5]: x = torch.randn(100).type(torch.FloatTensor).cuda()

In [6]: torch.dot(x,x)
Out[6]: 97.66580200195312

In [7]: xp = x.cpu().numpy()

In [8]: np.dot(xp,xp)
Out[8]: 97.66580200195312

body:
I have exactly the same issue with mac os 10.13.1 and python 3.6 via anaconda, when pytorch is installed from the source, both in 0.2.0 and 0.3.0.

```
In [1]: import torch

In [2]: import numpy as np

In [3]: x = torch.randn(100).type(torch.FloatTensor)

In [4]: torch.dot(x,x)
Out[4]: -3.6893488147419103e+19

In [5]: x = torch.randn(100).type(torch.FloatTensor).cuda()

In [6]: torch.dot(x,x)
Out[6]: 97.66580200195312

In [7]: xp = x.cpu().numpy()

In [8]: np.dot(xp,xp)
Out[8]: 97.66580200195312
```
